I have written a conditional statement in Python as shown below:
```python
bc = 'off'
if c.page == 'blog':
    bc = 'on'
print(bc)
```
Is there a more pythonic or shorter method to write this?

Yes, you can make the code more concise by using a conditional (ternary) expression. Here's how you can rewrite your conditional statement in a more Pythonic way:

```python
bc = 'on' if c.page == 'blog' else 'off'
print(bc)
```

This single line of code achieves the same result by using the ternary conditional operator, which is a more concise way to assign a value based on a condition.
